intro: Cracca uniovulata, commonly known as the single-seeded cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces a single seed per fruit, which is a distinctive botanical feature. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry habitats. Cracca uniovulata is noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
